channel.title: ScanX – Corporate Actions
channel.description: Auto-generated feed for ScanX Corporate Actions

item.title: Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan
item.description: Top News Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan 39 minutes ago Max India Limited allotted 20,000 equity shares under its ESOP Plan 2020 to eligible employees on December 12, 2025. The allotment increased the company's paid-up capital from ₹52.43 crores to ₹52.45 crores, with total equity shares rising to 5,24,50,362. The company made the disclosure in compliance with SEBI regulations to both stock exchanges.

item.title: Globtier Partners with AWS for Cloud Solutions
item.description: Globtier Partners with AWS for Cloud Solutions 7 minutes ago Globtier Infotech Limited has formed a strategic partnership with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enhance cloud adoption and digital transformation for global enterprises. The collaboration aims to improve Globtier's cloud consulting, migration, and managed services capabilities. The partnership targets sectors including BFSI, retail, automotive, manufacturing, and technology, offering services such as cloud optimization, cost management, secure architecture development, and comprehensive transformation support. Rajiv Shukla, Chairman and Managing Director of Globtier, emphasized that this collaboration is a significant milestone in the company's growth journey.

item.title: Trade Setup: Global Cues and Corporate Actions Shape Market Sentiment
item.description: Trade Setup: Global Cues and Corporate Actions Shape Market Sentiment 3 hours ago GIFT Nifty futures down 0.02% at 26,129.00, indicating a flat to slightly negative opening. US markets closed mixed, with Dow up 1.34% and NASDAQ down 0.24%. Asian markets show positive trends. Crude oil up 0.73%, while gold and silver decline. USD/INR trading at 90.30, up 0.09%. FIIs sold ₹2,020.94 crore, while DIIs bought ₹3,796.07 crore on 11-12-2025. Notable block deals in UFLEX, Yes Bank, and Gallantt Ispat. Key corporate actions include EGMs for several companies and NACL Industries' rights issue.

item.title: Kumiai Chemical Industry Forecasts 5% Revenue Drop and 32% Operating Profit Decline for FY26
item.description: Kumiai Chemical Industry Forecasts 5% Revenue Drop and 32% Operating Profit Decline for FY26 14 minutes ago PI Industries' major client, Kumiai Chemical Industry, has released concerning financial projections for FY26. Kumiai anticipates a 5% revenue decline and a 32% decrease in operating profit. This outlook could potentially impact PI Industries, given Kumiai's status as a key client. The significant difference between revenue and profit decline suggests margin compression for Kumiai, possibly due to increased costs or competitive pressures in the chemical industry.
